Absolutely! Here are some greens with a lot of flavor that can make your salads really stand out:

1. Water spinach - Also called "kangkong" or "Chinese spinach," this leafy green has a slightly sweet flavor and crunchy texture that makes it perfect for salads. It can last up to five days when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

2. Shungiku - Also known as chrysanthemum greens, this leafy green has a unique flavor that is slightly bitter and grassy. It can last up to a week when stored in the fridge.

3. Komatsuna - This leafy green is also known as Japanese mustard spinach and has a slightly peppery flavor. It can last up to a week when stored in the fridge.

4. Celtuce - This leafy green is also known as stem lettuce and has a crunchy, slightly bitter flavor that is similar to celery. It can last up to five days when stored in the fridge.

5. Red watercress - This spicy green has a peppery flavor that can add a lot of heat to salads. It can last up to five days when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

6. Borage - These delicate leaves have a slightly sweet, cucumber-like flavor that makes them great for salads. They can last up to five days when stored in an airtight container in the fridge.

7. Radicchio di Treviso - This type of radicchio has a slightly nutty flavor and a beautiful deep-red color that can add a lot of visual interest to salads. It can last up to a week when stored in the fridge.

Again, these recommended times are just rough estimates and depend on factors like the freshness of the produce, storage conditions, and humidity levels.
